skill.name: brainstorming
skill.tagline: Transform ideas into fully formed designs through collaborative dialogue
skill.shortSummary: Collaboratively brainstorm and refine ideas into detailed designs with validated approaches
skill.fullSummary: This skill helps you turn initial ideas into complete, validated designs through natural conversation. It guides you through understanding your project context, exploring multiple approaches with trade-offs, and validating information before presenting incremental design sections. The process ensures you get a well-researched, practical design that meets your specific needs.

highlights.title: One Question at a Time
highlights.description: The skill asks questions one at a time to avoid overwhelming you and ensure clear understanding. This focused approach helps refine your idea gradually while keeping the conversation natural and productive.

highlights.title: Multiple Validated Approaches
highlights.description: Always presents 2-3 different approaches with clear trade-offs and recommendations. It validates information through web searches to ensure you get current, accurate options based on real-world constraints and technologies.

highlights.title: Incremental Design Validation
highlights.description: Presents designs in small, manageable sections and checks with you after each part. This ensures the design evolves correctly and allows for adjustments before moving forward, preventing major rework later.

highlights.title: Ground Truth Verification
highlights.description: Actively verifies all external information by checking source credibility, recency, and resolving conflicts. This prevents reliance on outdated or incorrect information, ensuring your design decisions are based on accurate data.

steps.name: Understand Context
steps.description: Review your project files and ask focused questions to understand your idea
steps.details: The skill examines your current project state including files, documentation, and recent commits. It then asks targeted questions one at a time to clarify your goals, constraints, and success criteria.

steps.name: Explore Approaches
steps.description: Research and present multiple design options with trade-offs
steps.details: Using web searches to gather current information, the skill proposes 2-3 different approaches with clear pros and cons. It provides a recommended option with reasoning based on your specific context and requirements.

steps.name: Validate Information
steps.description: Verify all external information for credibility and recency
steps.details: Every piece of external information is checked for source authority, publication date, and consistency. Conflicting information is resolved through reasoning about source quality and timeliness.

steps.name: Present Design
steps.description: Share the design in manageable sections with ongoing feedback
steps.details: The complete design is presented in 200-300 word sections covering architecture, components, data flow, and other key aspects. After each section, you provide feedback to ensure the design aligns with your vision.

steps.name: Update Plan
steps.description: Integrate the final design into your project plan when applicable
steps.details: If you're working with a project plan, the skill automatically updates it with the finalized design. This ensures your implementation work begins with a clear, documented starting point.
